entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 16.1 a-b** *स विद्धो बहुभिर्बाणैर्दीप्तास्यैः पन्नगैरिव | ममार राक्षसं रूपं भूयः कृत्वा ... ||१६||*
Who was made by striking the demon's form again?
A) Vibhishana B) Ravana C) Karna D) Drona
entry.answer: A) Vibhishana • Verse states Vibhishana was made by striking the demon's form. • Ravana and Karna are other demons but not mentioned here. • Drona is a warrior, not a demon.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 17.1 a-b** *ददर्शाथ ततो जिष्णुः पुरुषं काञ्चनप्रभम् | किरातवेषप्रच्छन्नं स्त्रीसहायममित्रहा ||१७||*
What was the person disguised as?
A) Kirata B) King C) Elephant D) Sage
entry.answer: A) Kirata • Verse explicitly states "kirata" (a forest-dweller). • Other options lack textual support. • "Kiran" (forest) is a common term for kirata.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 18.1 a-b** *को भवानटते शून्ये वने स्त्रीगणसंवृतः | न त्वमस्मिन्वने घोरे बिभेषि ... ||१८||*
What epithet describes the person in the forest?
A) Kankanabhaya (Golden-faced) B) Dhananjaya (Wealthy) C) Bhishma (Terrible) D) Kritavarma (Victory)
entry.answer: A) Kankanabhaya (Golden-faced) • "Kanakaprabh" (golden-faced) is directly mentioned. • Other options are unrelated to the forest context. • "Kanak" (gold) symbolizes wealth and divine radiance.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 19.1 a-b** *किमर्थं च त्वया विद्धो मृगोऽयं मत्परिग्रहः | मयाभिपन्नः पूर्वं हि राक्षसोऽयमिहागतः ||१९||*
What is the reason for the arrow's strike?
A) To kill a deer B) To capture a demon C) To protect a cow D) To avenge a friend
entry.answer: B) To capture a demon • "Rakshasa" (demon) is explicitly named. • "Mriga" (deer) is a metaphor for the demon. • Other options lack textual evidence.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 20.1 a-b** *तेन त्वां भ्रंशयिष्यामि जीवितात्पर्वताश्रय ||२०||*
From where will the enemy be destroyed?
A) River B) Mountain C) Forest D) City
entry.answer: B) Mountain • "Parvatashraya" (mountain refuge) is directly stated. • Other options are not mentioned. • "Parvata" (mountain) is a common symbol for strength.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 21.1 a-b** *इत्युक्तः पाण्डवेयेन किरातः प्रहसन्निव | उवाच श्लक्ष्णया वाचा पाण्डवं सव्यसाचिनम् ||२१||*
Who spoke to the Pandava with a mocking voice?
A) Kritavarma B) Kirata C) Duryodhana D) Karna
entry.answer: B) Kirata • "Kirata" (forest-dweller) is the speaker. • "Pandava" refers to Arjuna. • Other options are unrelated to the mocking tone.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 22.1 a-b** *ममैवायं लक्ष्यभूतः पूर्वमेव परिग्रहः | ममैव च प्रहारेण जीविताद्व्यवरोपितः ||२२||*
What was the target of the strike?
A) A king B) A demon C) A cow D) A river
entry.answer: B) A demon • "Lakshyabhuta" (target) refers to the demon. • "Pariharana" (capture) implies a demon. • Other options lack context.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 23.1 a-b** *दोषान्स्वान्नार्हसेऽन्यस्मै वक्तुं स्वबलदर्पितः | अभिषक्तोऽस्मि मन्दात्मन्न मे जीवन्विमोक्ष्यसे ||२३||*
What is the speaker's condition?
A) Brave B) Weak C) Wise D) Wealthy
entry.answer: B) Weak • "Mandatman" (weak-minded) is directly stated. • "Darpita" (arrogant) contrasts with the speaker's weakness. • Other options contradict the verse.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 24.1 a-b** *स्थिरो भवस्व मोक्ष्यामि सायकानशनीनिव | घटस्व परया शक्त्या मुञ्च त्वमपि सायकान् ||२४||*
What is the speaker's promise?
A) To destroy arrows B) To protect the forest C) To grant freedom D) To avenge a friend
entry.answer: A) To destroy arrows • "Sayaakanaashani" (destroy arrows) is explicit. • "Ghatasva" (be still) implies a threat. • Other options lack textual support.

entry.question:
**Indralokaabhigamana-parva 25.1 a-b** *ततस्तौ तत्र संरब्धौ गर्जमानौ मुहुर्मुहुः | शरैराशीविषाकारैस्ततक्षाते परस्परम् ||२५||*
What weapons did they use?
A) Arrows B) Swords C) Bows D) Spears
entry.answer: A) Arrows • "Sarairashivishakara" (arrows with poison) is directly mentioned. • "Gajar" (elephant) is a metaphor for arrows. • Other options are not specified.
